title: Characters
text:
The char data type is used to store a

title: Strings
text: The String data type is used to store a sequence of characters (text). String values must be surrounded by double quotes:

The String type is so much used and integrated in Java, that some call it "the special 
ninth type".
A String in Java is actually a non-primitive data type, because it refers to 
an object. The String object has methods that are used to perform certain 
operations on strings. Don't worry if you don't understand the term "object" just yet. We will learn more about strings and objects in a later chapter.
